docTitle.titlePart:
THE ANTIBACTERIAL ACTIVITY OF NEW DERIVATIVES OF
4-AMINOQUINOLINE AND 4-AMINOQUINALDINE

byline.docAuthor: BY D. CALDWELL, w. A. COX, P. F. D'ARCY AND L. R. ROWE

byline.affiliation: From the Research Division, Allen & Hanburys Limited,

front.div:
Two new series of N-alkyl derivatives of 4-aminoquinoline and 4-
aminoquinaldine are described. Compounds in both series show
antibacterial and protein precipitating properties and it has been
possible to correlate bactericidal action and protein precipitation for
homologous members of the series. The bacteriostatic activity of both
series of compounds is characterised by maxima at C = 12 to 14, with
a marked decrease in potency at longer chain lengths. The bactericidal
activity differs from this in that activity is not greatly diminished with
the higher homologues. The 4-aminoquinaldinium salts are slightly
more potent bactericidal agents than the corresponding 4-amino-
quinolinium compounds. It is concluded that the mechanism of the
antibacterial action of these derivatives may be closely related to the
means by which they interact with proteins.
THE antimicrobial activity of certain polymethylene heterocyclic bis-
quaternary ammonium salts has been described on a number of occasions
(Collier, Potter and Taylor, 1953, 1955 ; Babbs, Collier, Austin, Potter
and Taylor, 1956; Austin, Potter and Taylor, 1958; Austin, Lunts, Potter
and Taylor, 1959)
